word\/document.xml: <g1>AFTERWORD</g1><x1/>I meant to end this book by discussing the blockchain’s impact on physical violence, on crimes of violence.
<g1>AFTERWORD</g1><x1/>I meant to end this book by discussing the blockchain’s impact on physical violence, on crimes of violence.
word/document.xml
I can’t.
I can’t.
word/document.xml
I don’t think there is an impact.
I don’t think there is an impact.
word/document.xml
I don’t know how the blockchain can prevent back-alley rapes, for example.
I don’t know how the blockchain can prevent back-alley rapes, for example.
word/document.xml
I could talk about putting sex work on an open ledger, but that would be weak tea, and it would feel like an evasion.
I could talk about putting sex work on an open ledger, but that would be weak tea, and it would feel like an evasion.
word/document.xml
This is a book of original theory, which explores what has never been said before about cryptocurrency.
This is a book of original theory, which explores what has never been said before about cryptocurrency.
word/document.xml
I don’t always know where the ideas are taking me.
I don’t always know where the ideas are taking me.
word/document.xml
But the impact on physical violence isn’t one of those destinations.<x2/>And, so, I am writing the afterword to my book, instead.<x3/>My journey through cryptocurrency began in a kitchen in Chile.
But the impact on physical violence isn’t one of those destinations.<x2/>And, so, I am writing the afterword to my book, instead.<x3/>My journey through cryptocurrency began in a kitchen in Chile.
word/document.xml
I was the featured speaker at a conference that also presented a panel of three experts on Bitcoin.
I was the featured speaker at a conference that also presented a panel of three experts on Bitcoin.
word/document.xml
My husband and I decided to rent a house through airbnb because we wanted to extend the couple of days into two weeks of bouncing around the country, which was magical.
My husband and I decided to rent a house through airbnb because we wanted to extend the couple of days into two weeks of bouncing around the country, which was magical.
word/document.xml
The house we ended up in, however, was outfitted for weddings.
The house we ended up in, however, was outfitted for weddings.
word/document.xml
Translation:
Translation:
word/document.xml
There were no fewer than thirty beds crammed into about twenty rooms that were linked by floors that consisted of cracked plywood below which there was a two-story drop.
There were no fewer than thirty beds crammed into about twenty rooms that were linked by floors that consisted of cracked plywood below which there was a two-story drop.
word/document.xml
It wasn’t a house; it was an adventure, with one working bathroom.
It wasn’t a house; it was an adventure, with one working bathroom.
word/document.xml
I prefer to consider it quaint.<x4/>The conference housed the speakers and attendants on a remote compound, which quickly filled up.
I prefer to consider it quaint.<x4/>The conference housed the speakers and attendants on a remote compound, which quickly filled up.
word/document.xml
The organizers asked us to put up the Bitcoin experts.
The organizers asked us to put up the Bitcoin experts.
word/document.xml
We gladly agreed.
We gladly agreed.
word/document.xml
They were pleasant, presentable fellows—albeit men who spoke of matters that made no sense to me.
They were pleasant, presentable fellows—albeit men who spoke of matters that made no sense to me.
word/document.xml
Fortunately, my husband develops hardware and software for embedded systems, so I am used to not always understanding things.<x5/>And, then, there was the morning after they arrived.
Fortunately, my husband develops hardware and software for embedded systems, so I am used to not always understanding things.<x5/>And, then, there was the morning after they arrived.
word/document.xml
One fellow slept in.
One fellow slept in.
word/document.xml
One insisted on cooking breakfast; I do not mean to cast aspersions upon him, because he was very pleasant and trying to be a good guest.
One insisted on cooking breakfast; I do not mean to cast aspersions upon him, because he was very pleasant and trying to be a good guest.
word/document.xml
But people do not cook around me.
But people do not cook around me.
word/document.xml
I cook; you eat; we get along fine.
I cook; you eat; we get along fine.
word/document.xml
He cooked.<x6/>So I was in a cranky mood when I stared across the breakfast table into the coal- black eyes of Michael Goldstein, whom I later learned <g2>is </g2>the Satoshi Institute.
He cooked.<x6/>So I was in a cranky mood when I stared across the breakfast table into the coal- black eyes of Michael Goldstein, whom I later learned <g2>is </g2>the Satoshi Institute.
word/document.xml
A remarkable young man.
A remarkable young man.
word/document.xml
Michael is nicknamed Bitstein by those who have affection for him…
Michael is nicknamed Bitstein by those who have affection for him…
word/document.xml
and, really, all you have to do is meet him for that to happen.
and, really, all you have to do is meet him for that to happen.
word/document.xml
When I looked into his eyes, I had an oh-so-familiar feeling because I do have mirrors in my own bathroom.
When I looked into his eyes, I had an oh-so-familiar feeling because I do have mirrors in my own bathroom.
word/document.xml
“This is a fanatic,” I concluded.
“This is a fanatic,” I concluded.
word/document.xml
I happen to like fanatics, depending on the topic under discussion, of course.
I happen to like fanatics, depending on the topic under discussion, of course.
word/document.xml

And I had nothing against the topic of Bitcoin, which had started to interest me because so many people I admired took it so darned seriously.<x7/>With an unwavering stare, Bitstein told me the blockchain was an open ledger that delivered anarchy.

And I had nothing against the topic of Bitcoin, which had started to interest me because so many people I admired took it so darned seriously.<x7/>With an unwavering stare, Bitstein told me the blockchain was an open ledger that delivered anarchy.
word/document.xml
Okay.
Okay.
word/document.xml
I immediately understood the power of crypto to bypass the central banking system…
I immediately understood the power of crypto to bypass the central banking system…
word/document.xml
<g3>if </g3>it was widely adopted; <g4>if </g4>it was not outlawed, <g5>if</g5>…
<g3>if </g3>it was widely adopted; <g4>if </g4>it was not outlawed, <g5>if</g5>…
word/document.xml
But anarchy?<x8/>All my reservations were political and entirely different than those of my husband, who joined us after about fifteen minutes.
But anarchy?<x8/>All my reservations were political and entirely different than those of my husband, who joined us after about fifteen minutes.
word/document.xml
Brad waited until Michael took a breath, and then he said one word:
Brad waited until Michael took a breath, and then he said one word:
word/document.xml
“scalability.”
“scalability.”
word/document.xml
It was the first time Michael stumbled.
It was the first time Michael stumbled.
word/document.xml
He said, “we’re working on that.”
He said, “we’re working on that.”
word/document.xml
I saw Brad lose some interest.<x9/>I didn’t.
I saw Brad lose some interest.<x9/>I didn’t.
word/document.xml
I didn’t know what scalability meant in this context, except in the definitional sense.
I didn’t know what scalability meant in this context, except in the definitional sense.
word/document.xml
But I didn’t care because the word “anarchy” had been uttered, and <g6>that </g6>I knew about.
But I didn’t care because the word “anarchy” had been uttered, and <g6>that </g6>I knew about.
word/document.xml

Michael seemed more than happy to leave behind scalability for politics, and I pursued why he thought the dawn of freedom had arrived like the cavalry on an algorithm.<x10/>Michael answered, and he did not convince me, but he did prompt me to read.

Michael seemed more than happy to leave behind scalability for politics, and I pursued why he thought the dawn of freedom had arrived like the cavalry on an algorithm.<x10/>Michael answered, and he did not convince me, but he did prompt me to read.
word/document.xml
As did my old friend Jeff Tucker.
As did my old friend Jeff Tucker.
word/document.xml
As did the incredible Stephan Kinsella.
As did the incredible Stephan Kinsella.
word/document.xml
Other people tried to raise my awareness, as well.
Other people tried to raise my awareness, as well.
word/document.xml
Mihai Alisie, of Bitcoin Magazine, asked me to write for him on anarchism, for example.
Mihai Alisie, of Bitcoin Magazine, asked me to write for him on anarchism, for example.
word/document.xml
I don’t think I adequately thanked the man for having such confidence in me.
I don’t think I adequately thanked the man for having such confidence in me.
word/document.xml
And, at that point, his confidence was probably ill-founded.
And, at that point, his confidence was probably ill-founded.
word/document.xml
I submitted one article to <g7>Bitcoin Magazine</g7>, which was far from my best work.
I submitted one article to <g7>Bitcoin Magazine</g7>, which was far from my best work.
word/document.xml
It drew a better response than I deserved: they were willing to “work with me.”
It drew a better response than I deserved: they were willing to “work with me.”
word/document.xml
I thanked the editor, and backed away with the absolutely genuine excuse that I did not know if I had anything original to contribute to the discussion.
I thanked the editor, and backed away with the absolutely genuine excuse that I did not know if I had anything original to contribute to the discussion.
word/document.xml
I had nothing new to say.
I had nothing new to say.
word/document.xml
I had not yet grasped the hard, cold edges of<x11/>crypto theory, and I did not understand its power.
I had not yet grasped the hard, cold edges of<x11/>crypto theory, and I did not understand its power.
word/document.xml

Which meant I had not yet staked out the one area where I could and can contribute something original: the integration of crypto-anarchism with the rich history of anarchist-libertarian theory that has spanned centuries.<x12/>As I read further, I became ashamed of myself.

Which meant I had not yet staked out the one area where I could and can contribute something original: the integration of crypto-anarchism with the rich history of anarchist-libertarian theory that has spanned centuries.<x12/>As I read further, I became ashamed of myself.
word/document.xml
Crypto-anarchism: the most important political development in my lifetime had occurred without my noticing it happening, which is inexcusable.
Crypto-anarchism: the most important political development in my lifetime had occurred without my noticing it happening, which is inexcusable.
word/document.xml
I had spent my time on “official” libertarianism— donation-driven and donation-defined institutes, tax-funded universities, academic journals.
I had spent my time on “official” libertarianism— donation-driven and donation-defined institutes, tax-funded universities, academic journals.
word/document.xml
When did freedom ever come packaged in tax dollars, awards, and honors delivered at rubber-chicken dinners?
When did freedom ever come packaged in tax dollars, awards, and honors delivered at rubber-chicken dinners?
word/document.xml
Freedom is a street fight.
Freedom is a street fight.
word/document.xml
Crypto- anarchism took over the streets without my noticing.
Crypto- anarchism took over the streets without my noticing.
word/document.xml
I notice now.<x13/>Enter Roger Ver.
I notice now.<x13/>Enter Roger Ver.
word/document.xml
Our first contact was an email that he sent out of the blue.
Our first contact was an email that he sent out of the blue.
word/document.xml
Roger’s email “had” me at hello, because he used the word “voluntaryism.”
Roger’s email “had” me at hello, because he used the word “voluntaryism.”
word/document.xml
In 1982, I was one of three people who created the modern Voluntaryist movement during a bull-session in a two-bedroom rent-controlled apartment in Hollywood, California.
In 1982, I was one of three people who created the modern Voluntaryist movement during a bull-session in a two-bedroom rent-controlled apartment in Hollywood, California.
word/document.xml
I remember my fingertips literally buzzing from the excitement of the ideas and plans we were forging back then:
I remember my fingertips literally buzzing from the excitement of the ideas and plans we were forging back then:
word/document.xml
Carl Watner, George H.
Carl Watner, George H.
word/document.xml
Smith, and me.
Smith, and me.
word/document.xml
But, mostly, Carl.
But, mostly, Carl.
word/document.xml
It was and is almost unbelievable to me that, decades and decades later, a voluntaryist visionary named Roger would be knocking on my door (so to speak).
It was and is almost unbelievable to me that, decades and decades later, a voluntaryist visionary named Roger would be knocking on my door (so to speak).
word/document.xml
He asked me to write for his site.<x14/>Roger had good timing.
He asked me to write for his site.<x14/>Roger had good timing.
word/document.xml
In science-fiction language, I had finally <g8>grokked </g8>bitcoin; I tip my hat to Robert A Heinlein for that word, BTW.
In science-fiction language, I had finally <g8>grokked </g8>bitcoin; I tip my hat to Robert A Heinlein for that word, BTW.
word/document.xml

I also tip my hat to Roger and the entire bitcoin.com crew for never—and I mean not once, in any manner whatsoever—trying to influence the ideas as I spun them out in my sometimes clumsy attempt to integrate crypto-anarchism into the broader traditions of classical liberalism, Austrian economics, and individualist anarchism.<x15/>Assembling the book turned into a massive rewrite followed by a period of fierce editing.

I also tip my hat to Roger and the entire bitcoin.com crew for never—and I mean not once, in any manner whatsoever—trying to influence the ideas as I spun them out in my sometimes clumsy attempt to integrate crypto-anarchism into the broader traditions of classical liberalism, Austrian economics, and individualist anarchism.<x15/>Assembling the book turned into a massive rewrite followed by a period of fierce editing.
word/document.xml

The book before you now is based on the columns I serialized at bitcoin.com, but at least half of the material is new—the section on justice especially.<x16/>Before closing, I must address another aspect of crypto-anarchism.

The book before you now is based on the columns I serialized at bitcoin.com, but at least half of the material is new—the section on justice especially.<x16/>Before closing, I must address another aspect of crypto-anarchism.
word/document.xml
I did not expect this side benefit, but there you have it; life is often unexpected.
I did not expect this side benefit, but there you have it; life is often unexpected.
word/document.xml
Crypto has made me young again.<x17/>I had the immense good fortune to befriend and to spend many years with people who helped to found the modern libertarian movement.
Crypto has made me young again.<x17/>I had the immense good fortune to befriend and to spend many years with people who helped to found the modern libertarian movement.
word/document.xml
Murray Rothbard used to joke at conferences in the 1980s that libertarianism could be eliminated by one well-placed bomb.
Murray Rothbard used to joke at conferences in the 1980s that libertarianism could be eliminated by one well-placed bomb.
word/document.xml
He was correct.
He was correct.
word/document.xml
Now it is immense.<x18/>There is a downside to my great good fortune, however.
Now it is immense.<x18/>There is a downside to my great good fortune, however.
word/document.xml
The people with whom I grew into intellectual adulthood now make me feel old, mostly because so many of them are dead; I was usually the youngest one in the room.
The people with whom I grew into intellectual adulthood now make me feel old, mostly because so many of them are dead; I was usually the youngest one in the room.
word/document.xml
Feeling old is feeling tired, with nothing in sight that makes your eyes sparkle.<x19/>I remember Murray, and his passion—I remember it so vividly.
Feeling old is feeling tired, with nothing in sight that makes your eyes sparkle.<x19/>I remember Murray, and his passion—I remember it so vividly.
word/document.xml
But, over years, something went wrong with his passion.
But, over years, something went wrong with his passion.
word/document.xml
It came from anger, I think, and it was expressed by attacking other people.
It came from anger, I think, and it was expressed by attacking other people.
word/document.xml
I remember an after-conference dinner at which a fellow diner had the misfortune to say something positive about Keynes.
I remember an after-conference dinner at which a fellow diner had the misfortune to say something positive about Keynes.
word/document.xml
And, then—God help us all!—he elaborated.
And, then—God help us all!—he elaborated.
word/document.xml
Murray finally exploded into a rant in his Brooklyneque-squawk of a voice, and the fellow started to back down.
Murray finally exploded into a rant in his Brooklyneque-squawk of a voice, and the fellow started to back down.
word/document.xml
I think he would have backed his chair out of the restaurant, if that had been a possibility.
I think he would have backed his chair out of the restaurant, if that had been a possibility.
word/document.xml
He conceded that Keynes may have been wrong on “this” issue, and on “that” one, and Keynes was probably weak on historical context.
He conceded that Keynes may have been wrong on “this” issue, and on “that” one, and Keynes was probably weak on historical context.
word/document.xml
Murray slammed his open hand down on the table and declared, “And Hitler was ‘weak’ on the Jews!”
Murray slammed his open hand down on the table and declared, “And Hitler was ‘weak’ on the Jews!”
word/document.xml

Everyone laughed, but it was an attack, nevertheless, and a harbinger.<x20/>Crypto sparkles like a spinning thing in the sun, and the sparkle is clean, because it does not come from anger or from demeaning someone or something else.

Everyone laughed, but it was an attack, nevertheless, and a harbinger.<x20/>Crypto sparkles like a spinning thing in the sun, and the sparkle is clean, because it does not come from anger or from demeaning someone or something else.
word/document.xml
The passion is positive.
The passion is positive.
word/document.xml
A door has been flung open, and I don’t know where the path outside of it will lead me because I could never have predicted the path up to this point.
A door has been flung open, and I don’t know where the path outside of it will lead me because I could never have predicted the path up to this point.
word/document.xml
Let it evolve.<x21/>One thing I know.
Let it evolve.<x21/>One thing I know.
word/document.xml
I am in good company; the bitcoin.com crew has been nothing but decent and grinning toward this woman who plopped down into their midst.
I am in good company; the bitcoin.com crew has been nothing but decent and grinning toward this woman who plopped down into their midst.
word/document.xml
This means the world to me.
This means the world to me.
word/document.xml
I don’t know where I will end up next, but I do know that technology—not merely crypto—is going to give us all a wild ride for the rest of our lives.
I don’t know where I will end up next, but I do know that technology—not merely crypto—is going to give us all a wild ride for the rest of our lives.
word/document.xml
I will have my hands on the keyboard, trying to put the dizzy changes into historical perspective, even as they happen.<x22/>I have a chance of doing so…
I will have my hands on the keyboard, trying to put the dizzy changes into historical perspective, even as they happen.<x22/>I have a chance of doing so…
word/document.xml
because I am young again.
because I am young again.
word/document.xml
I am hopeful.
I am hopeful.
word/document.xml
And nothing, nothing is impossible.
And nothing, nothing is impossible.
word/document.xml
That’s what this book has meant to me.
That’s what this book has meant to me.
word/document.xml
I pause in this journey to thank you for being part of it.
I pause in this journey to thank you for being part of it.
word/document.xml
